column8: I successfully taught the robot how to do the task.
column9: The robot correctly updated its understanding about aspects of the task that I did want to change.
column10: The robot wrongly updated its understanding about aspects of the task I did NOT want to change.
column11: The robot understood which aspects of the task I wanted to change and how to change them.
column13: I had to try to undo corrections that I gave to the robot because it learned the wrong thing.
column14: Sometimes my corrections were just meant to fix the effect of previous corrections I gave.
column15: I had to re-teach the robot about an aspect of the task that it started off knowing well.
column16: When the robot learned something wrong it was difficult for me to undo that.
column17: It was easy to re-correct the robot whenever it misunderstood a previous correction of mine.
